techmeme.title: Sources: Nvidia added ~200 staff to its self-driving R&D team in Beijing and will end the year with ~4,000 staff in China, up from ~3,000 at the start of 2024 (Bloomberg)
Harvard says it's releasing a high-quality dataset of ~1M public-domain books, created with funding from Microsoft and OpenAI, to help train LLMs and AI tools (Kate Knibbs/Wired)
Meta donates $1M to president-elect Trump's inaugural fund; sources: Mark Zuckerberg gifted Meta's Ray-Ban smart glasses to Trump at Mar-a-Lago on November 27 (Wall Street Journal)
NeuBird, which is using generative AI to automate IT site reliability operations, raised a $22.5M seed extension led by M12, following a $22M seed in April (Marina Temkin/TechCrunch)
Honda plans to dissolve a self-driving vehicle partnership with GM after GM announced plans to exit robotaxi development; Honda had invested $852M in Cruise (Shoya Okinaga/Nikkei Asia)
